availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
State of Kentucky
Owsley County Sct

At a special term of the Owsley County Court L L Manes Esqr presiding the resignation of Elisha B Treadway having been received and committed to reccord by order of a former regular County Court the Court proceeded on Saturday the 22nd of March 1862 to appoint John Peters as high Sheriff of Owsley County to transact all of the business of a regular elected Sheriff during the unexpired term of Said office where upon Said Court ordered the same to be certified to the Governor that he might be commissioned

Atteste
John C Cole Clerk
By S A Chastan D, C,

Owsley Co
Jno Peters
Sheriff
Com Issd Apr 24 1862
